Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: fumachaplain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night this past week. The room was nice and clean, and we had a wonderful view of downtown Miami and the port. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and worked to find us a nice room on a high floor. Parking was a little tight in the garage, especially if you have a large vehicle. Also, if you are not used to staying downtown in a big city, you might be surprised by the outside noise that pretty much goes on through the night. But nothing more than in any other city. I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Misery”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for business, my regular hotel was booked solid and I couldn't get in. (waited too long to get reservations). Hallways were hot and stuffy, apparently there was no A/C on the 9th floor. The room was worn and shabby, bathroom had a mysterious substance on the ceiling, as well as something over the bed. The shower was dingy, could have used a good bleach scrub. The bed was hard as a rock, didn't get any sleep. And the A/C unit in the room appears to have given me a fungal based bronchitis. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service was Impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: angm212
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a wedding this past weekend and was very impressed with the fabulous hotel service. I have stayed at many courtyards and was blown away by the friendliness of the staff, etc.. From checking in at the front desk to the bellman and restaurant staff, they couldn't have been more friendly. The food in the restaurant was very tasty and served in a timely manner. Chris was very helpful with directions to restaurants and Marvin was more than ready to assist with our late checkout in regards to the wedding. I work for a four star property in Chicago and this certainly matched up to the service level from the staff. I certainly did not expect this from a Courtyard and was pleasantly surprised. I would definately stay here again just for the great service and a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FlayKnoll
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, great view from downtown, easy to move by car. Parking inside the building, good value. I'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “Close to my office, but would not stay again. Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsWilko
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days on a business trip. Hotel quite basic (but that is the Courtyard style), clean, but a bit tired and dated. Bedroom very dingy and gloomy and very, very noisy. I am not a light sleeper, but I had to sleep with ear plugs every night. Small gym but good equipment. Would chose somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: aveclesfilles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to catching a cruise on Feb 26th. The location was perfect for getting to the port and the shuttle for $5 was most ideal. Checked in rather late on the 25th but it was quick and efficient. Definitely loved the complimentary bottle of water provided by the front desk especially after a long day of traveling. Free WiFi was another added bonus! The room smelled a bit musty when we walked in but overall the room was clean and exactly what we needed for a one night stay. Having the balcony was a nice little bonus to check out the construction site across the street. No but seriously it was nice to have. Checking out the next morning was total chaos but the front desk explained that it had something to do with 2 buses showing up that weren't expected. I will say this, Anthony was a professional and perfect to deal with during this mess. He was incredibly helpful and even made a point of having some inconsiderate man who just walked up to the counter wait so that he could help me being as I was waiting in line. It's the small things in customer service and by him doing this went a very long way with me. I would stay here again for it's proximity to the port, room size and the customer service received.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Marriott Miami”
Reviews.Author: Abifloro
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel. We stayed one night. The rooms are average, neat and clean. You have easy access to any of the downtown venues, including the AA Arena as well as easy access to and from the Interstate. All in a all, a fairly decent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Over priced”
Reviews.Author: curryj33
Reviews.Content: PROS:Great front desk service, excellent concierge. Free wifi. Lots of restaurants. Close to airport . 10 min drive from South Beach CONS: high price parking, over priced room, poor view ( construction outside of window ) . Sheets/duvet dirty. No free shuttle to airport. No continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service, good location”
Reviews.Author: DJA76NY
Reviews.Content: It's not the Intercontinental or the Conrad, but neither are the prices. If you want the Miami scene, this shouldn't be your choice. I stayed one night for business and could not have encountered a friendlier staff in a big city. The rooms are average, but mostly neat and clean. You have easy access to anything downtown, including the morning traffic noise. All in a all, a fairly decent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Worked to make things right...”
Reviews.Author: we_are_off_again
Reviews.Content: We checked in late at night and the only available suite was room 214which is adjacent to the air handling units. There were no other suites sowe had to deal with it because I didn't want the kids in a separate room. The hotel staff was very gracious and gave us 1 night free which was a pleasant surprise

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel centrally located in downtown”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business. This Courtyard by Marriott, as I heard, used to be a Howard Johnson so I didn't expect it to be anything but okay. Check in was swift and I was offered complimentary drink and snacks at the frontdesk. The room was clean and of good size with standard amenities you would expect from a Courtyard hotel. Next to the hotel was a big construction site but it didn't bother me as I stayed there only at night. Parking was easy as the hotel had its own multi-storey garage (paid). The room price was a bit high considering the hotel class and the season. PS: The hotel did not provide umbrellas so do bring yours in the rainy season.

Reviews.Title: “overall good for pre and post cruise”
Reviews.Author: queenb034
Reviews.Content: This was a pre and post cruise stay for a mother and daughter trip..Overall I would rate it good...A little pricey but it was clean, convenient and fit its purpose... The Pros : Free shuttle to the Port of miami cruise ships. If you choose a cab it is approx 7 dollars. 5 walking blocks to Biscayne bay and Marina, with restaurants and shops..10 minute drive from Miami international airport.. 3 blocks from the Convention Center.. Rooms were clean and average size...Honored my request for early check in and a late check out..Which is rare for chain hotels..Decent pool size.. The Cons : Inside the hotel there is only one restaurant "La Bistro"..Only breakfast is good and it is a litlle pricey for bad food... 2 blocks from I-95 which could be good or bad depending if you are driving or not...If you are, it"s great access..If not, the noise and traffic can be annoying. An honorable mention to the front desk employee named Anthony...Very knowledgeable about the surrounding area and courteous..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: pfdb
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the middle of downtown Miami. I don't like Miami so I won't hold that against the hotel. We had a suite at the end of the hotel closest to the entrance to I-95. Not a good idea. Apparently in Miami, they don't need mufflers on cars and motorcycles. The noise of these vehicles starting up the ramp and warp speed was unbearable. Even my hard-of-hearing husband could hear them! They woke us up early in the morning gunning their engines as they raced by. Stay at the other end of the hotel! We got there around 3:30. The Bistro restaurant was closed. So we ate from their little grocery area. I had a frozen small meal, hubby had a tuna sandwich and we each had a drink. The sandwich was soggy on one side - no, WET!! Took it back. Over $30 for this. In the morning, we went to the Bistro for breakfast. You stood in a line like a fast food restaurant. They wanted $10 just for scrambled eggs and biscuit. That's not including coffee or juice! Then we would have had to eat off of styrafoam and use plastic utensils. So for probably over $30 it just wasn't appealing to us. We ate after we got on the turnpike to head home! Room total cost with parking was around $265. We should have had a waiter and good restaurant service for that price! Staff was nice. One guest complained that there was no beach! Hello!!! It's in the middle of downtown Miami! The guy at the counter was very nice and explained how to get to the beach. Credit for not laughing at this man! I hope to never have to go to Miami again so I can't say I'd stay here again. But I guess if I was forced to visit the area, I would stay here but at the other end of the hotel away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Marriott stay”
Reviews.Author: gwilliwoo
Reviews.Content: This was not only the worst Marriott experience I can remember having but worst lodging experience I have had in a while. First the key system just did not work. I was constantly having to go to the lobby for fresh keys only to have them work no better. I would have to try them at least 10 times before they would open a door and one set would not open the work out room no matter what I tried. And then the lady they sent up to help me told me it was because I need to clean the key on my clothing before inserting it in the slot. Really?! She then wiped it on her pant leg 5 times before that worked. At which time she looked at me and said "see, you just have to clean it." Okay, REALLY???!!! You think that is normal that someone has to wipe the key on their pants, try it in the slot and repeat that process 5 times before a door opens? Then, the staff just was not helpful in really any other way. The hotel really doesn't offer food. When I asked for a recommendation I was told I wasn't really going to have luck anywhere since it was Valentines day. I asked if there was anything near by and the guy rattles off a columbian place, a brazilian place, etc. waiving his arm in random directions like the scarecrow and not telling me names or anything. I realized I wasn't going to get anything out of him so gave up. I wandered the neighborhood on foot really not finding anything that seemed to match his random descriptions. Ended up picking up not so great sushi to take back to my room. Then came nighttime. Now, I know this isn't the hotel's decision but they could have warned me that the city had decided to do road construction IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT - two nights in a row! OF course, if they had warned me I would have found another hotel but really if one can't sleep why would you expect them to stay in a place designed for, duh, sleeping. All of that almost makes me forget that my alarm clock also did not work so I took my chances the first night. I reported that on my way out to work and by the time I got back they had replaced it and I had a nice apology note from the maintenance person in my room. So, I do want to credit them for taking care of that issue promptly. The room was also clean at least. So if you don't want any help from the hotel staff and plan to stay out on Ocean Drive all night, this hotel may work just fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, expensive restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: mchmjc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise. There are many restaurants within an easy walking distance, and lots of shipping as well. We had a suite with a separate living room and sofa bed, which was more than adequate for the three of us for our short stay. The room was very clean and well-equipped. There were even two small balconies to enjoy the limited view of the ships in port. The pool and fitness center seemed nice, although we were not they long enough to enjoy either. The hotel restaurant was somewhat pricy for breakfast, but the portions were generous. The hotel offers a shuttle service (small fee) to the port, although a taxi would be similarly priced. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: rdb7272
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a pretty good location to get around to area attractions. The restaurant downstairs is a little too expensive for what they offer. The rooms are a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the nearby Hyatt?”
Reviews.Author: Ileana79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night to get away from my obnoxious roommate at the nearby Hyatt where we had been staying to atten a two week long school function. in any case, the rooms here were much more comfortable...and cheaper! Nice pool. And a laundry room! And free wi-fi internet! My only complaint was that the staff here are a little intrusive. I was given the third degree at check-in and the staff at the market gave my companion a hard time when he went to get some snacks. Seriously, Marriott staff, give your guests some privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Much better option in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: shawnrog
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of better alternatives in the downtown Miami area. Not at all impressed with this Courtyard. Noisy AC in the room and no thermostat so you spend a lot of time trying to figure out how to set the AC. The Internet access is like syrup, not even good enough to stream a Netflix movie. Only Decaf in the room for coffee. TV stations not working and when I asked the front desk how to get CBS to work I was told by the staff he wasn't knowledgable of how the TV selection worked so there was nothing he could do. Probably the worst part of the stay so far is the unscheduled wake up call that rang my room at 5 AM this morning wishing me a great day and welcoming me to the Marriott. I stay at Marriott properties all over the world this one is subpar, its not in a nice area, its a bit run down, the closets are so small the hangers stick out the door and the staff doesn't seem to care. Avoid this place and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: aajean32
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is quiet convenient because it was closely located to another hotel where I attended a conference. However, there is construction next door which was very noisey as well as the cars on the streets nearby. I was on the 12th floor and was still disturbed by the sound of the vehicles. I found the hotel quite expensive too even when they granted student discount, it was not awarded to me because I was told I made reservations after the cut off date. The amenities (shampoo, soap, lotion and conditioner) were quite cheap and the towels were thin. Decent enough for a necessary trip but not a holiday hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: randomMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on the 12th floor and the street noise sounde like it was outside our window if we were on the 1st floor. Adjacent room & hallnoise were also a problem. That being said the room was nice, free wifi, staff very good, Close to Port of Miami for cruisers and they provide a shuttle there for $5 pp. A 15 minute walk away is the waterfront restaurant/shopping complex...very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of money for what you got”
Reviews.Author: MargK2
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel late and there was no where to eat and we were all starving. They had some snack stuff at the check in desk and I got the tuna sandwich and the bread was soggy and it was gross. My husband had the ceaser salad and the lettuce was limp. I would think a hotel chain like the Marriott they would have room service. We went down the next morning to get breakfast and it was like a cafeteria. It wasn't that good either. The price of this hotel was over $300.00 a night and you would think you would get alot more for that. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Night Review of hotel room, snack bar service, bayside area, and transportation from Fort Lauderdale Airport”
Reviews.Author: azindy
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas day about 7pm and was surprised to see the hotel with so many people. However, with it's close proximity to the port of Miami and so many people leaving on cruises the next day (including us) it was a hopping place. The downstairs reception was very friendly and helped us find our way to Bayside which was only 3 blocks east and 3 blocks north and was VERY surprised at the amount of shops and restaurants that were open on Christmas night. The walk is in a downtown area but seemed perfectly safe and there were a lot of people out. The whole Bayside area appeared open and as busy as any Saturday night. (And Christmas was on a Sunday this year) We enjoyed an outside Italian dinner on the bay overlooking all of the yachts. Our room had some renovation to it but obviously it was still an old building with popcorn ceilings. For one night it was perfectly fine. We had a suite that had a bedroom with a king bed and a sitting area seperate with a pull out couch and sink/fridge etc. We didn't really need that but had to choose that to have a second bed for our child. It felt like an old room with new things in it. The bar/snack area was a little bit unusual and the service was lacking. We actually sat at the bar and drank a beer and drank slowly and never was asked if we wanted another. Finally, we did get the attention of the server and ordered again. The same place was open for breakfast and we had already checked out and wanted to pay cash form some coffee and they said they couldn't take cash. Transportation from Ft. Lauderdale: We arrived at the Fort Lauderdale Airport at 4:40pm on Christmas night and were able to take public transportation all the way to the hotel. First we took the Tri Rail from Fort lauderdale to Miami and got very lucky to make the last train at 5:03pm. We wouldn't have made the shuttle if we had checked our bags! The schedule said there would be a 7:03 train also but arriving at the station found out that the last train had been canceled for the day due to the holiday. We actually arrived at the station about 5:03 bought our tickets and waited about 10 minutes and the train arrived. Overall felt very lucky as we were unsure of transportation options on a Sunday Christmas evening. We took the Tri Rail to the Metrorail transfer and then took Metrorail to Government Center. At times the Metrorail didn't feel very safe and on a future visit I would most likely make a different arrangement for transportation. At the Government Center we transferred over to the Metro Mover and had to use the elevator due to our suitcases and found it soiled with urine. We also wanted the Omni loop and somehow got on the Brickell loop. Luckily we recognized our error and were able to get off and go in the opposite direction and still get off at Knight Center Station. Once at Knight Center Station we exited the building and it was less than a block walk to the hotel. Overall I would do the mass transit option again if I felt the Metrorail section could be safe. Maybe it was just because it was evening on a holiday. Overall this route only cost us $7 per person. $5 for the Tri Rail and $2 for the Metrorail and then because we had been on Metrorail the Metro Mover was free.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near everything!”
Reviews.Author: CharlitaatBC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of the city which gives it a great view, and with a great location! You have a wide variety of places to eat at, a couple of grocery stores, and the Bayside Mall with a lot of stores to go shopping at. The stuff is very friendly and the rooms very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK/Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: HPRIC
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night because we were passing through and this hotel served that purpose just fine. The best part of the stay was the friendly and helpful staff at the front desk and bar. Also, the bayside mall with tons of shopping, waterfront restaurants and night life was a short walk away, that was nice. You can tell there has been some limited upgrading, but the hallways and guest rooms still look outdated, this hotel needs an overhaul. We had a suite and the layout was a little weird. But it was clean and everything worked, so whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an older hotel”
Reviews.Author: LocoTravelers
Reviews.Content: Perfectly acceptable for a 1 night stay when having business in the area. Would certainly stay here again if the price was right. Friendly staff was helpful with questions and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: Rymo2300
Reviews.Content: The hotel has clearly been upgraded in the past few years (i.e. - lobby, restaurant area), but where the ownership decided not to upgrade, it is quite obvious (i.e. - room product). Comparing this to new construction Courtyards certainly dates the hotel and the hotel lacks the pop and wow factor that I have come to expect at newer Courtyards. That said, great location and easy to get around to downtown Miami and Miami beach from here, which makes the location factor very valuable. Overall, it was an average Courtyard. Not great, and certainly not terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: adulttraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before leaving on a cruise. We didn't explore the neighborhood because we were only there one night and were tired from traveling most of the day. Check-in was efficient, our room was very clean, comfortable bed, plenty of nice big towels. The only minus was no magnifying/make-up mirror in the bathroom. Since we arrived in the evening, we ate dinner in the hotel's bistro restaurant, where we also ate breakfast the next morning. The food was very good, we weren't expecting gourmet, so we were satisfied. The concierge told us about the shuttle to the pier, which is a really good bargain--$5 a person!! The driver was polite and helpful and the van was clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay there if I cruise out of Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “This Courtyard has what you need.”
Reviews.Author: Eng23lt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Downtown Courtyard before a cruise. The hotel is in a good location close to many restaurants and the people mover system. This hotel has a great and friendly staff. The staff upon being notified of an issue I had with the toilet in the room acted quickly and had maintanence and housekeeping to my room within 5 minutes. The problem was quickly solved and upon checking out that morning I was given a free breakfast due to the problem I encountered. I am always glad to see a hotel property take care of their guests, I was not expecting nor was I going to request any kind of compensation for the barhroom issue but it was given to me with genuine concern that they may have not lived up to expectations. Good job!

Reviews.Title: “Good Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jwolinsky
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located downtown, so they typically run good specials for a weekend getaway. Rooms are very nice, and the location is convenient being close to the Bayside Market and a short drive to South Beach. Parking is $15 per day, which is not bad for downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, more like a motel”
Reviews.Author: LdeS
Reviews.Content: Pizza Take-away menus under the room door. More like a motel than a hotel. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: CheeseburgerBob
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff and service they provide are 4-5 star level! They are willing and able to help with anything and friendly. The rooms are average to ok, but they are clean, comfortable and large. Parking garage is connected to the hotel and is a definite plus in downtown Miami. The lobby is new and inviting/comfortable. Pool area is nice and clean. It can be a little confusing getting to it, but that is a product of the one-ways and roads in downtown. Very close to Brickell and easy access to other areas downtown, port (cruises), I-95 and Metromover. Good for families and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: flhawkeye
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit above-average by Courtyard standards re amenities, but the location, price and the staff make it a 4-star place. Downtown location is absolutely ideal, walk to everything and a few nice views from the top floors (there are 14). Price is excellent compared to other downtown Miami hotels. The staff is to die for...they will jump through a million hoops to make the impossible happen, always with a smile, as though there is absolutely nothing more important than their customers' satisfaction. You can't ask for more than that! Fantastic experience at this hotel, you won't be able to beat it for a superb Miami experience. My only gripe was that the A/C unit in the room was sort of noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Circusdog
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Courtyard Miami downtown on business. I've stayed here before, and find the hotel was a typical Marriott; i.e. you know what you'll get when you book. The hotel is well placed for travellers or those on business - Brickell is within walking distance, Bayside is a short walk or Metromover (the free monorail that services much of downtown Miami) and the Port of Miami is a short cab ride away. Parking charges show this is one of the last somewhat-resonably priced garages in Miami - $15 a day. I stayed here on business with a colleague, and he tried the hotel restaurant for his evening meal - he said the meal was cold and not worth the cost. I didn't eat at the restaurant, so can't comment on quality of food or service. I was disappointed that the hotel didn't offer a complimentary breakfast of some sort. My room was clean, offered wireless internet access and faced US1. There was some traffic noise, so I'd recommend getting a room on a higher floor to minimise the noise. The usual in-room ameneties were present (coffee maker, etc). The staff were pleasant and professional. The hotel didn't do anything that ranked it better than average, but likewise there was nothing that was problematic either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bolulu
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. Walking distance to Bayside complex, Downtown shopping & convenient for cruise takers. The rooms are comfortable, perhaps a little past their 'best sell-by' date, but clean, large & no complaints. The BIG difference here is the staff. Fabulous training job by Marriott! The reception staff in particular (Marvin & Joanna especially) just couldn't do enough for us. I mention this aspect because in most of my other reviews it's the disagreeable, unwelcoming staff that spoil the stay. This place was just a breath of fresh air & I recommend it very highly. Thank you all; I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service for wedding party”
Reviews.Author: Dmercado421
Reviews.Content: Ms. Pena helped get all my 60 family members accommedated. I had a destination wedding through carnival and the hotel helped me find a third party shuttle service called Airport Transports (Mr. Wilmer Silva) who did an amazing job picking up the passagers from the Miami and FLL airport and taking them to the hotel, then to the cruise and back to the airport after the cruise. The hotel was amazing at a great location for my family members to walk to get food and see shops. Also there is a free train you can take to see the city within walking distance.Great experience. Parking 15 dollars a day. Also they helped me print out some luggage tags that were needed for the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “its ok........”
Reviews.Author: rochelle f
Reviews.Content: overall it is a ok hotel to stay in...... I had a couple of issues that I was not pleased with. the bathrooms are pretty small and the water in the shower was warm, so no hot shower before bed time, no complimentary breakfast, not even a banana given, I have never stayed at a hotel whereas they didnt have a complimentary or a full breakfast so that was new to me,really with the money that was paid for one night, I needed to print off my boarding pass for my cruise, the printer was down, we had to pay for shuttle service to get to the port which was just around the corner, Overall it was a clean hotel and right in the heart of downtown .

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: lionking05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Labor Day weekend. It's right in the middle of downtown Miami, really close to Port of Miami and Star Island. Honestly I did not mind that the hotel was not in South Beach. We spent the evening in South Beach and came back to the hotel. It was not that far. For a room like this we would have paid much more in South Beach and we chose to spend less but still stay at a good place. The rooms were remodeled and very clean. Complimentary breakfast was good too. I have no complains and I would suggest this hotel to anybody who would go to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: burchard
Reviews.Content: Hotel facility was your typical Courtyard Marriott. Clean, nice, and great location for a pre-cruise stay. What was really remarkable was the staff. We used a Marriott bonus certificate for a free room and felt like royalty. There was literally nothing these folks wouldn't do for us. I hope after my cruise I have remembered her name correctly but Joanne at the front desk was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Keiko96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our cruise. Rooms were recently remodeled and everything was fresh. Nice to have a balcony. However very noisy from the traffic outside. They need soundproofed glass.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Cruise visitors”
Reviews.Author: Itinerary Goddess
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It was clean, nicely decorated and had comfortable beds. The view of the pool and downtown Miami was also lovely. My only issue was the cost of transportation. There is not much around this hotel so transportation by cab can get expensive. The hotel does run a shuttle though the night we arrived the night staff knew nothing about this and it wasn't until the day we were leaving that it was offered to us. Shuttle to airport $30 to Cruise port was about $15. Anywhere else was about $25 such as South Beach or Coconut Grove. Our first night exploring we spent $125 in cabs. We were taking a Carnival Cruise so this hotel was conveniently located near the port. Would stay there again if that was the arrangement/

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: R5C5H8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in mid-August on our way down to Key West. It was a nice enough hotel and was within easy walking distance of the Miami waterfront. Our room was on the top floor over looking the pool. The room was very nice for the price range, small refrigerator, king size bed, flat screen tv, and decent bathroom. The main negatives were that the elevators were very slow, there were no clean towels available when we went out to the use pool area, and there is not a full-service restaurant on site. The front desk staff was very friendly. We self parked in the parking deck that is adjacent to the hotel and that was very easy. Overall, it probably is not a hotel that you would want to stay at for a week, but for just a night or two, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “the best Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: hags54
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and stayed here for 1 night precruise. The staff could not have been more helpful and courtious. Bed was fantastic and the view was outstanding! I will definitely stay here again and again.............

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Seaton01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and everything was great, nice clean spacious room with a view of the pool, clean towels and plenty of pillows. The reception staff were so polite and helpfull even ring once you are in your room to check everything is ok, Caroline checked us in and remembered my name for the rest of the stay. The free coffee all day long is appreciated. Downtown Miami was a lovely surprise and this hotel is great location to Market Place which is where everything happens at night, they have live music lots of restaurants and shops and the harbour is beautiful at night. Will definatley return to this hotel and downtown Miami, very family orientated which we didnt expect. Whilst there we went to the everglades and it was a great day including a city tour.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL WITH THE NEW DOWNTOWN”
Reviews.Author: cpazmino
Reviews.Content: Location is great, you can walk to some nice restaurants and also to Bayside. Rooms are clean, pool area is very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linmoran
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in hotel with my family of two kids and husband. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Its an old hotel with outdated rooms. Rooms clean. Bathroom very very small. Aircon room very very loud. With the outside noise of street traffic and aircon, all four of us awake during night. The room very stuffy as aircon poor quality. Double beds small. We were wrecked the next day ! Would not stay here again. Would pay extra next time to stay in a more decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaQuito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Downtown Miami, just a short walk from the Bayside! Service was great, check in and out was fast! The only issue i will say is the noise, but you are in downtown so definately wasnÂ´t expecting peace and quite!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, meets the standard of a Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: StellaV
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and did not run into any problem. It offers the basics - clean room, free wifi, great location, helpful staff, etc. It meets your expectation of a Marriott hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay else where”
Reviews.Author: wen_c82
Reviews.Content: We were here 1 night for a pre-cruise stay. The hotel is convenient to Port of Miami, taxi a bout $10. There are a couple places to eat within walking distance. Other than that, there is not much good to say about this hotel. One night maybe one too many. The room is average size but it didn't look clean, bathroom looks old, ceiling is low, air con was loud. We were on the 9th and it was so noisy that we couldn't sleep. Our room looked nothing like the hotel photos. The worse Courtyard I've stayed, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre-cruise hotel! Can't beat the location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: The_Concierge_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Courtyard for one night pre-cruise. It was a great location at an affordable rate. It is situated very close to the Port of Miami and our room rate included shuttle service to the Port which was quick and hassle-free. The Bistro was very busy when we arrived - filled with screaming young women for some talent/fashion show who clogged up the entire lounge/seating area but once they departed, the Bistro & lobby went back to normalcy. We miss Marriottâ€™s buffet breakfast but the fare offered was not bad. The new interactive screens were quite helpful for finding out about the area and the staff were all very friendly, helpful and efficient. The computers in the lounge area were useful for checking emails at no cost, especially when not traveling with a laptop. The building next door has a people-mover station so we went down to Mary Brickell village for dinner but I would not do this alone or at night as the characters on the people mover were abit suspect and there was no visible security at any of the stops. The stations are all pretty bleak, lacking adequate lighting and are rather run-down, many with graffiti. The roads surrounding the hotel bring constant traffic noise but do request an upper floor to eliminate this discomfort. The room was clean and spacious with a comfy bed and all the standard amenities. Thereâ€™s a quiet rooftop pool which was not busy at all and a well-equipped fitness centre on the same level. We highly recommend this hotel for a pre-cruise overnight for its price and proximity to the port. It is simply the best place for a short stay in Miami. We will definitely stay here when going on a future cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, avarage rooms”
Reviews.Author: RVMENG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good. The room was clean and the location is great if you are not looking for beach in Miami. I got a room facing the swiming pool (and some offices of downtown Miami). The view was just a building but it was quiet. I think if you get a room facing the street or the parking lot, you are going to hear all the traffic and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Poor beds, loud, and unable to provide adjoining rooms for families”
Reviews.Author: radridesit
Reviews.Content: Rooms are worse than the basic carival cruise ship room. Not a secure hotel. Food service staff friendly and help though. Should not be called a Marriott. Poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: surgerychick21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great except for the parking. We had our full sized truck and had some difficulty manuvering it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ronk4p
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed last week at this hotel in Miami. The hotel has best location and surrounded with so many things to do. We went to south beach and we liked our location better. Here you can enjoy downtown life and beach both. Staff at the hotel was well trained. They put me in wrong room upon check in and when they realized it was mistake by them they treated me like king. Free drinks and food. Best hotel in miami downtown

Reviews.Title: “Like Finding A Diamond in Your CrackerJack Box!”
Reviews.Author: Marklab
Reviews.Content: Don't let the unassuming exterior (or the surprisingly low rates) fool you. This is a well run, quality hotel, filled with top notch amenities and a professional, friendly staff. The lobby / cafe area is fresh and modern. The room was spacious and immaculately clean. Our "balcony" led directly out to a really pleasant open air 7th floor swimming pool. The location was very convenient to the harbor and the Bayside Marketplace area. We were on an extra day after a cruise vacation and this property was the perfect finish to our trip. Having to leave at 4am to get to the airport was no problem - the desk had a cab waiting for us by the time we got off the lift. Excellent 5 star experience for a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “oh stop the insanity”
Reviews.Author: pambear83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at your downtown Marriott for our anniversary and I have to say, we were so disappointed that we will never stay there again. Overall our experience was horrible and I would advise anyone against staying at your properties. The complete invasion of privacy and trust in the hotel was disgusting but in the end the lack of concern from the employees was just as bad. There were several small details we did not like but the big incident that was completely unacceptable involved an employee breaking into our room. I was in the restroom and my husband had stepped outside. While I was in the restroom with the door closed, I heard knocking on our outside door. I ignored it as we had the privacy sign up and did not want to be disturbed. A moment later, the door opened and a male employee walked in, empty handed mind you. I poked my head out of the bathroom as I heard the door open and panicked seeing a stranger in my room. I asked him to get out and he did not, instead he argued with me saying I ordered something. I did not order anything, his hands were empty, there was a privacy sign on my door and above that why did I have to ask him to leave more than once??? He stayed in the room for a few moments with me repeatedly asking him to leave and it was when I finally screamed that he did. I was very scared and shaken up when I called down to the front desk and the did nothing to ease my concerns. When my husband came back up I told him the situation and he was also furious with the lack of concern on an employee break in into our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location but earplugs are mandatory”
Reviews.Author: Limerick1ady
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights pre cruise. Our room was a large family room on the 8th floor with a safe and refrigerator. The staff were very helpful and the hotel provides a shuttle service to the port. The location is close to bayside market place and buses to South beach. Perfect for a short stay. Unfortunately, the outside noise was excessive. The hotel is located at a corner which has access to I-95. We are not light sleepers but were woken several times over the 3 nights by the traffic outside. There is also a construction site across the street to guarantee you have some early mornings. Nice hotel but we won't be staying here again due to the outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “NOISE”
Reviews.Author: LucciBsb
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel if you canÂ´t tolerate NOISE. I stayed for about a week and they gave us the highest floor, as I asked for a quiet room at check in. Unfortunately, what I could hear was excessive noise of sirens, horns and traffic from outside, all day and night long. And to make the experience even worse, they had these terrible LOUD AC units in each room, that sometimes we had to keep turning on and off... Other than that, the room was ok, renovated, as well as the lobby, even though the building is pretty old and ugly from the outside, giving a bad impression upon arrival. Also, theyÂ´d better charge for internet than offer a complimentary one so extremely slow. I had to give up using my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: illini_alumni03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Courtyard Marriott for one day for pre-cruise lodging. The hotel is very very close to the port of Miami and there is an inexpensive shuttle from the hotel to the port . We checked in REALLY late and the front desk staff was more than accommodating as well as quite friendly. Furthermore, the rooms were not only modern decco, they were extremely clean. So far as the noise is concerned, there are some rooms closer to the street, just request a room away from the street level and/or the noise. This hotel is highly recommended not just as pre-cruise lodging but in general. Five star service for a fraction of the price and YES my husband and I received our government discount.

Reviews.Title: “So much noise from the street.”
Reviews.Author: AureliaSC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a bad spo in a way. Very close to 95. You could hear so much street noise!! Honking...Honking....Honking...Fire trucks....Fire trucks. The room was OK. It was clean. Bathroom was very small. Staff was very nice. Food was good and price was not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: maassenl
Reviews.Content: Hotel lodging fare practices are questionable. I found out after I checked out that my colleague and other government employees were charged $24 less per night. When I called the hotel to fix the situation, they were very rude, unhelpful and unwilling to find a solution. The hotel was noisy and there was a 12 inch stain on the carpet. It smelled dank and musty. Wouldn't stay at the hotel again if it was the last place on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: AlegreteRSGuga
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Courtyard for 5 days.I loved the hotel specially the guest laundry that's in the 5th floor there, you can wash your clothes for 1,5 dollars and dry them for 1,5 dollars.And the vending machines that you find in every floor.

Reviews.Title: “best of two worlds”
Reviews.Author: denemir
Reviews.Content: the courtyard downtown is the perfect platform for staying before and after a cruise. the staff is friendly and helpful. the lens cap of my camera fell from the 12th floor balcony , i snapped a photo, in which you can bearly see the spot where it fell, i went to the lobby and a wonderful young man name chris or curt retrieved the cap for me. these are the little things that count. before after the cruise it was easy to explore miami using the metro mover and train. i've recommended this hotel to my sister and brother in law they're travelling later this month.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations at every turn”
Reviews.Author: pope1228
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler (business and pleasure), I'm pretty picky about hotels. This is my second time staying at this hotel. The convenient location (if you are doing business downtown) cannot get better. The cost is very competitive and for a hotel of this quality could charge a hair more and be ok. The staff is amazing and always smiling and seeing how they can make your day better. Rooms are spacious and clean. Overall, anytime I need to come to Miami this is going to be my choice. Food quality of bistro/marketplace was REALLY good. Needed to get a quick bite and had the ribs, really surprised with the quality and portion size. Very impressed with everything at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre & Post Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agrant45
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here before and after our cruise. The rooms are very clean and the internet is free. There isn't much of a view, but we don't care about that. The staff is very friendly. They helped arrange a shuttle to the pier ($5 pp), got a room ready for us when we checked in early, and gave us information about local sights. The fitness center is small, but its nice and I was able to get a workout in. A taxi cost $35 from the airport and we used SuperShuttle ($16 pp) to go back. Overall we definitely recommend this hotel should you be going on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Short Trip to Miami”
Reviews.Author: TureyguaML
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, close to the Bay side, the staff was really helpful, thanks to Francesca for her help and recommendations. Grate price for King size room. I will come back. For transportation from the Miami International Airport I recommend the Super Shuttle, only $16.00

Reviews.Title: “Standard Courtyard, exactly what I expected, no problems.”
Reviews.Author: bretts11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Downtown Miami for one night prior to flying home from the Miami Airport. We found the hotel to be in a very convenient location for both the airport and experiencing downtown Miami. We were able to walk from the hotel to the oceanfront shopping and the Miami Heat's stadium within 10-15 minutes. The parking garage is attached to the hotel and only costs $15 per day for Courtyard guests. The garage even has hotel entrances on each floor which is very conventient. We did not utilize the fitness center or the pool. We found the "business center" to have extremely slow internet access and it was pretty crowded. The Bistro downstairs served drinks quickly and conveniently also. Breakfast is not complimentary, which is standard at all Courtyards. The room was smaller than standard Courtyards, but overall was nice and clean. No issuse at all. The room had a small balcony overlooking the pool with a view of the city. We were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Convenient to Port”
Reviews.Author: 1027rm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight for a cruise. Room was very clean. Staff was friendly. The parking garage was a little difficult to find as the entrance is on the side street next to the hotel. A little pricey for a basic room though., but everything downtown is. Had to pay to park. Convenient location for the port. Pool area was nice and empty, which my daughters loved. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: olups
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was really friendly and the hotel has a nice lobby with free internet and sometimes free coffee and sometimes even free newspapers. I did not quite understand the system when the coffee and the newspapers were available but it was pleasing when they were. Internet is also available in the room but is very slow. Location is downtown Miami which is boring but parking prices were ok and bus transport to Miami beach costs about 2 Dollars. My room was comfortable with a king size bed and a lot of pillows. There was a fridge and even a sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People/Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShilohSRQ
Reviews.Content: Spent one night on business. Staff is super pleasant and accommodating. King room was roomy, super clean and comfy. Bathroom is nothing great nor are amentities but then again, the rooms are priced accordingly. Bistro to grab a quick bite is quite good-best egg/bacon sandwich I've had in long time. Self parking is a big annoying - would prefer valet, but again, you aren't paying top dollar to stay here. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: aniedani
Reviews.Content: The room was so spacious and cleaned. The Bed was huge and great. They have quinoa shampoo and conditioner in the large bathroom. They can arrange a 5 USD transport to the port of miami. The staff is very nice and helpful. If you need drinks or food at night they have in the lobby and they have a bar, and a starbucks. But you have a lot of places to eat or shopping near this hotel. The metromover is near the hotel and you can go by it or walking to bayside marketplace. We didn't walk around at night, so we can say anything about it. And we bought our dinner and breakfast at wallgreens that is one block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok.....thats all”
Reviews.Author: melow
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night driving from Orlando to Key West... Pro's Carpark is easily accessable directly from the hotel Beds are comfortable Quick and simple breakfast area We were upgraded to a suite, although more about that in the con's below Con's I assumed that Miami was one place and wanted to stay on Miami Beach, I then realised that Miami Beach is a different place to Miami Downtown, this was a fault on my part, we went to Miami Beach anyhow and this place was crazy! I liked it : - ) The suite!!!!! we were upgraded to a suite that had a balcony which was 2 feet from a tramline, we decided to stick with the room anyway although it become too noisy when we tryed to sleep and called down to reception who provided us with a quieter suite, I do not know how they manage to sell this room at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most easy access to your room From garage”
Reviews.Author: drleo66
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok ,new furnitures , tv etc. very clean and large rooms we have two connected rooms. internet is every where. and they have a really good bussines center near bar. The best thing in hotel is parking. at the park you can go with car to your room floor and easy acces to room, its comfortable for luggages, and park fee is very chip .

Reviews.Title: “uncareing”
Reviews.Author: reed-lycan
Reviews.Content: On April 25 2010 my new husband and i checked in to the hotel. We took our stuff to the room. After flying all day from Illinois we were tired and hungrey, We went down and ask front desk where we could go to get something to eat. After the two at the desk argued of which way for us to go we said never mind we'll find something. After walking around a 3 square block we decided just to go back to hotel. We got showers and went to bed. We were to get on our cruise ship around 8ish the next morning. when we got up and went to get our information that we kept in a 5 star binder we noticed it was gone. someone had came in our room when we were out the night before. They got 700.00 dollars our passports conformation on our rental car and plane tickets. we reported it to front desk. they said no one had entered our room. we were so up set. they wouldnt even call police for us. We finally got a wonderful police officer to help us. She took us to get a emergency passport. We missed one whole day on cruise ship, it cost us 440.00 for a new passport and we had lost our 700.00 we had saved to spend on our honeymoon. all together we feel Marriott owe us 1500.00 for all we lost. we have tried to get them to repay us for what their employees took from us. I warn each and everyone not to stay with this company, their all so heartless and uncaring. If you would like to no more please e-mail me at ----- Very Unhappy Brenda Lycann

Reviews.Title: “You'll be pleased!”
Reviews.Author: malter2010
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice in downtown miami. The room was great (2 double beds), great flat tv with lots of channels, super clean and the staff was really friendly. They have in the bar starbucks coffee to buy, and in the morning, even though they don't offer breakfast in the price of your stay, tey have free coffee, which, was actually pretty good. You won't regret going with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “100 Nights Later, Still a Favorite”
Reviews.Author: ffsteve
Reviews.Content: This visit puts me over 100 nights at the Miami Courtyard Downtown over the last 18 months. From the very first the staff have been terrifically helpful, attending to every need. The rooms are clean, and since the remodel are all "new". Everything's worked, and when it didn't it was promptly attended to. I've had my choice of hotels, and each time I've opted for the Courtyard which is convenient to the Metromover (in the next building) and easy in/out car parking. Downtown walking is fine during the day, although might be iffy after midnight. But I've walked to/from the Bayfront park many times, returning to the hotel after the band there packs up around 11 without issues. Weekends downtown are tough, particularly on Sundays where just about everything is closed. Brickell restaurants are an easy stroll, or Mover ride. Street noise can be bothersome at times. But overall this is definitely a great choice for reasonable hotel in downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms, clean and good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ruth016
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite, that had a separate bedroom, fridge, and microwave. When we first checked in, we were given a room on the 2nd floor which sat above a highway and monorail. There was a lot of traffic noise, so we asked for a higher room, and they quickly accomodated to provide one immediately above on the 3rd floor. It was still loud, but better than the first one. After the first night, we awoke to find that the freezer had thawed out and there was a large pool of water in the kitchenette and living room carpet. The hotel quickly responded to move us to another room on the 14th floor. This was perfect... away from the noise. The hotel has a nice roof top pool and a great fitness area. The hotel is in walking distance to several stores and casual restaurants, and far away from the trendy parts of Miami. The suite had two balconies, but they were un-useable -- very small, and no furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: kitzelover
Reviews.Content: After seeing some horrible reviews regarding construction, I was nervous to find out my Priceline hotel was the Courtyard, although i trust the Courtyard brand immensely. On my way to the hotel, I called and found out all renovations were completed and experienced the level of quality I have grown to expect from Courtyard. The room (furnished with two double beds because I ended up bringing a friend) was spacious, clean, well equipped (except for the glaring ommission of a clock radio) and had free Ethernet connections. Parking was $15 a day which, considering the area, was not too bad and they let me keep my car there until the end of the day I checked out. I noticed many guests enjoying cocktails and meals from the lobby bar/restaurant and if the weather had been bad, would have done same myself. The hotel is only two blocks from the Metromover (which is in itself rather confusing), about 4 blocks from Bayside and pretty close to the dock where the cruise ships depart from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: cricri7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before leaving on a cruise of the Carribean islands from the port of Miami. I bid on Priceline and won this hotel for 85$. I thought that was incredible for the money! There were far more pros than cons for this hotel: PROS: *Incredible value if you bid on Priceline (I compared with the website and the rooms were going for 225$ instead of the 85$ I bid on Priceline!!) *Excellent service: An employee named Chris helped us out. We were staying for only one night and he directed us to an Italian restaurant called Puntino's that was very good and not too expensive. He even came out on the street to point us in the right way. He offered us the shuttle for the Port of Miami that costs 5$. Some hotels don't welcome warmly clients who won on Priceline but this was not the case here. *Great rooms: I had a king size bed with a huge plasma television, a small balcony, very clean all around, very quiet...I did not hear a thing during the night. *They have 4 computers you can use in the restaurant where you can access the Internet for free. CONS: *The location during the weekend is deserted. I did not feel safe in walking at night. We did a run on the free metromover on Sunday morning and saw a big number of homeless people because there is a homeless shelter near by. We were 2 women traveling together so we experienced little tinges of fear at times. It is the financial district so nothing much is opened on weekends. *The hotel was recently renovated and there are still chemical scents in the rooms. *Breakfast is expensive and not very good. We were very happy with our win on Priceline and would stay there if I ever do a cruise from Miami in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Luxury”
Reviews.Author: annen1
Reviews.Content: When we booked a post cruise stay at the Courtyard Marriott in Downtown Miami we expected a clean pleasant looking room with an adequate bathroom. We were not disappointed. We didn't expect the nicely decorated suite, with a wet bar, microwave, and a coffee maker. In addition to the wet bar , the living room contained a sofa, chair, a large HDTV in a credenza, and a desk with a Wi-Fi internet cable. As I mentioned before the bedroom and bathroom were in line with the rest of the suite, The only negative experience was that Marriott Courtyard is phasing out their breakfast buffet in favor of a Bristo Cafe. The food was good but the price was high $30.; for 2 people for eggs, bacon, home fries, toast, jusice, and coffee. Previously breakfast was complimentary. The economy delivers blow. Over all the Marriott Downtown was a very good experience. I would like to specially note the friendly helpful attitude of all of the staff members with which we had contact.

Reviews.Title: “Take care with the OVERBOOKING”
Reviews.Author: BrazilMarcio
Reviews.Content: I left my country (Brazil) and iniciated a trip cross USA. I was booked and had a voucher to Marriot from jan 29th to February 2nd. One day before my check in , I receveid a call from a local agent , saying the Hotel was full due to overbook and offering me another option. As the offer was an upgrade I took it. In 25 years travelling was the first hotel overbook I had, and it was Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent”
Reviews.Author: goseminoles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a return trip from Cancun. We have stayed before and were not as happy as previous occasions. However, it is in a great location and I always feel safe in this hotel with my family. We stayed at a VERY Luxurios hotel in cancun and i think that didnÂ´t help our impressions.

Reviews.Title: “Still ongoing renovations”
Reviews.Author: Roombaguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times. This time though, as other reviewers have noted, there is ongoing renovations and construction the other side of the street. On the evening I arrived, 2/3 elevators were shut down because work being done. The front desk is being overhauled. On the flip side, rooms are nice and you get free Internet. Also, for the inconvenience of the renovations, a free continental breakfast is given, which is a good idea considering. Staff are nice and helpful. All-in-all, I still recommend this hotel, but all will be better when work inside and the building next door are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: ZozoCalypso
Reviews.Content: Currently there is refurbishment underway of parts of this hotel. So there is no proper lobby/front desk, no bar,, no restaurant, no room service. Continental Breakfast is served on plastic plates in the Conference hall.and mini-bars are dry! Add to this - street work outside that persisted until midnight and another major construction site opposite the hotel for the morning wake up call. It makes the $200+ rate I paid for an otherwise pleasant room, a poor deal. If they are still refurbishing when you plan to book, demand a low price or go elsewhere. I'd place the personal value of a King SIze Room currently at this hotel at - $80

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel 2 nights after a cruise it was a very short taxi ride from the port the hotel was modern bright and a very large bedroom with 2 beds Very friendly staff and good buffet breakfast Not a lot to do around the hotel at night but close to the buses for South Beach

Reviews.Title: “lacking”
Reviews.Author: oracleviking
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard hotel in down town Miami. Great hotel and staff, especially Jim at the bar who was vey friendly and knowledgeable. Daytime there are shops to visit in the area but the problem is at night, there is nothing around. We searched for restaurants and only found three in the immediate vicinity. There is a great monorail which circles the area, great views, free. At night you look down and just see empty streets, shops closed, This is for quite a large area, it was all very very quiet, scarily so. On speaking to locals its normal, there is nothing there a night. The only live area was Bayfront, 3 blocks away but that was very busy, tacky and loud. Not recommended. You have to drive to South beach or places like Coconut Grove (recommended) to find restaurants and any type of decent life. In the heat of down town Miami there are two great restaurants, Fratelli Milano, 213SE 1st Street. This is a small very very friendly place where all know each other and everyone is made welcome. On sitting down a man eating neaby, who works locally said "Good choice" re venue. Highly recommended especially the food and staff. Another restaurant was Puntino Italian restaurant 353 SE 2nd Street. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the manager Ernesto made our stay very welcome. The food was excellent. Again highly recommended food and staff

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: bossguy
Reviews.Content: Wasn't the nicest Courtyard I have been to but it was OK. Really nothing special about this hotel. Location is OK cleanliness OK, staff OK, just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stlbabe
Reviews.Content: Went to Miami to celebrate 21st anniversary and we stay at the Courtyard. I was able to use my sister's associate discount so I didn't have to pay alot of money but the hotel was very nice. The location was close enough to the bus line (we caught the bus to South Beach for $4.00 per person-round trip, cheaper than renting a car and paying to park) or you can take metromover. The staff was very nice. I ordered food from the hotel restaurant and the food was very good. They hotel had a business center, fitness center and a nice pool. If you have kids in college and trying to taking a vacation on a budget, this is a great location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ticoSanJose
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel! it was awesome, great location in Miami!!! Close to Bayside Market (about 6 blocks) and to the downtown stores. My room was on the 14th floor with an amazing view of the city and the bay!!!, also my bed was very comfortable!! you can spend the whole day in bed!!! The staff was very helpful and friendly, specially Lucila and Chris at the Front Desk and Peter (doorman), and our maid ( I did not remember her name) We ordered room service and it was very good! The Ropa Vieja was delcicious!!! I had a courtyard club sandwich, it was good but the french fries were reheated... I definitely will stay in this place again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaish
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed here for the Christmas weekend. We had a wonderful time at this hotel...the service was exceptional, esp room service, the rooms were very clean, and the staff were all very friendly. However, the breakfast should be included in the price. The location is really convienient since there is a CVS pharmacy a block away, the major shopping street in downtown Miami, Flaglar Street is about 2 blocks away...good for shopping. Also, the Bayside market Place is a short distance away but walkable...my husband and i walked there almost everyday. i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit the downtown miami area.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, if a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: OzYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is great for a one night visit prior to going on a cruise, I would not want to stay there for an extended period because of the noise, try and get a high room to the front overlooking the bay. Wehad a room to the rear overlooking the construction work, but it was weekend so was not a problem, it is not the cheapest place for a beer but there are bars nearby. All in all a good pre cruise hotel. Better than the RED ROOF last year, avoid that place like the plague

Reviews.Title: “Marriott rarely disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: june252000
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute one night stay at the Courtyard Miami Downtown two days before a cruise from the Port of Miami. My rate included buffet breakfast and transportation to the Port. When I arrived at the hotel I was upgraded to a one-bdrm suite as I'm a Silver Elite Marriott rewards member. That was very unexpected and definitely appreciated. The lobby looked like most other Courtyard properties I've stayed in, open and spacious with an eating area at the far end. The internet cafe was to the right of the dining area which included four terminals (free.. always a plus..) but there were some problems with the connections. My room was nice, a spacious suite with separate living and sleeping areas. The bed was Marriott comfy however I could tell the hotel itself is old, but renovated, as the pipes in my bathroom were LOUD and the airconditioners were also loud. The room had that 'hotel smell' but for one night it was fine. I ate at the restaurant in the evening and again in the morning and was very pleased with both the food and the service. I caught the shuttle to the Port in the morning and though there was an initial mix up with the time, the staff at the hotel were quite accomodating and called me to let me know the time had changed. As well, when the shuttle came I was at the internet cafe. Someone actually came over to get me to ensure I was not left behind. All in all, this property reminded me of why I remain a loyal Marriott rewards member. It's not always because of the physical hotel itself as the last few I've stayed in can do with some updating and remodelling. What keeps me loyal is Marriott's service standard which is high and consistent, no matter what property you are in. The Miami Courtyard downtown provided the level of service I have come to expect and appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vonluvscruising
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Courtyard Downtown after a very very long day of flying from Nevada. The lobby was gorgeous! We walked up to the desk to check in. I had booked the hotel through EasyClick.com and they immediately charged my card. However, they failed to make a reservation with the hotel. The lady at the front desk, Cedelia, was wonderful. She said that this had happened with EasyClick a lot. Luckily (due to numerous cancellations from looming Hurricane Ike) she had a room for us. It was a beautiful king room overlooking the pool and downtown. She even gave us complimentary breakfast buffet coupons for the next morning for our trouble checking in. Loved the room! We were too tired at that point to explore downtown or go to Bayside so we ate at the hotel's restaurant. It was good and reasonably priced. The breakfast buffet the next morning was also good. Checkout was a a breeze. We caught the shuttle to the Port of Miami at 10:30 the next morning for $5.00 per person which was also reasonable. I will stay again the next time we are in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!! a gem!”
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thinking it would be an average hotel, but when we arrived we were very pleasantly surprised. It was extremely good value, I don't think you can find a better hotel for the price. The lobby was very nice with a large fish tank. The rooms were clean and very nicely furnished with flat screen TV's. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice. There was a good gym and swimming pool, and you could use the internet for free in the business centre. You could eat breakfast in the hotel, or walk one block to starbucks or a couple of other places. Good location - 10 minute walk to bayside marketplace, in the heart of downtown miami. The staff were very helpful with helping us out booking tours etc - special thanks to George! The only downside to the hotel is that there is a construction site opposite, however we found that this had no effect on us as there was no noise during the night. Also the air conditioner was a little loud but we managed to sleep fine. Overall this is a superb hotel and excellent value for money - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place good rate for latin americans”
Reviews.Author: Nanycassino
Reviews.Content: Well located..just in the heart of downtown Miami. Good and confortable rooms. Nice personnel. Special rate for latin american people.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but Checked out 2 hours after arriving”
Reviews.Author: mosdefmage
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an OK location, and the staff was great. the construction site across the street didn't bother me. The rippled carpets and worn furniture didn't drive me out the door. What did was the smell. The room smelled bad. Really bad. And while I was unpacking and thinking about how bad the room smelled I turned the AC on and found out why. It emitted what I am sure was a toxic plume of gas into the room. I booked a room in another hotel, packed my stuff and left.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel sucks”
Reviews.Author: rdhSantaBarbara
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst large hotels I have stayed at for a business trip in a long time--constant loud noises from highrises going up nearby, perpetual traffic with a major freeway entrance a block away---yes--lots of horns honking, and even a very busy fire station a few blocks away---with no apparent noise insulation in the hotel. To make matters worse, they put me near the elevator and ice machine (constant noise). I am not that picky, and don't normally write reviews like this---but this hotel sucked!---rdh

Reviews.Title: “Great cruise meeting point”
Reviews.Author: leroyk
Reviews.Content: My family used this hotel as a launch point for cruise. It has a great location near the port. Downtown Miami is confusing to navigate at first. So finding the hotel was easy. Getting to the hotel was "fun" with Miami's one way streets. Warning this hotel can be busy with the bus loads of travelers that stay here courtesy of the cruise lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: wown15
Reviews.Content: The room was definitely very big and clean, we were very happy with what we recieved. We stayed on the top floor and had a great view of the water. It should be noted that dowtown miami is pretty quiet so if you are looking to stay in the middle of things, this is not the place. The staff was great and gave us passes to a popular club in South Beach that is hard to get into. The passes also allowed us to bypass the line; hotel offered passes to a couple of different clubs. Pretty convenient to access the busy parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Nina8
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite. It was decently appointed. The bedroom and living room was spacious. There was a small kitchen area and I think the couch was a pull out. It even had two balconies. Our room faced the light rail station but it didnâ€™t disturb us. (Iâ€™m a light sleeper.) The service was excellent. There is a breakfast bar & restaurant in hotel. The staff was friendly. Check-in and everything was easy. One caveat is that store close around 6pm in the immediate area. Biscayne Bay is a short taxi ride away @ $7. There is a shopping area and some restaurants like Bubba Gumps and an all you can eat Argetinian steak house â€œThe Knife.â€� The ride was about 20 minutes from the airport (with no traffic/non-rush hour). It was about 20 minutes from Port of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review: not perfect but problems were solved fast...”
Reviews.Author: yopi
Reviews.Content: Everyone is very nice and helpful. The hotel is well located, walking distance to Bayside Park, just next to the People Mover... Best to get a room in the upper floors, as there is some noise from the street. Rooms with odd numbers are smaller, but are quiet. Just take care of not getting room ending with -13, as it is next to the housekeeping room and the wall and bed jump each time that door is used. Rooms with even numbers are larger, you can see the ocean and the river. But they are a bit noisy (nothing to really bother you!) Had a few problems, but all of them were solved immediately with a smile and even with a little bag of treats asking for forgivenes...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: jtwiz
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my 7th stay at this hotel (it is literally 1 block from a customer's office) and had my typically good stay. I was on the 14th floor with a large, king-size bed room which was quite clean and nice. In fact, I have always had spotless rooms at this property. It is ideal for a business traveller needing to be in the downtown area. It was cheap in the off-season at $119 per night. The hotel has the usual small, but functional gym that most Courtyards have, plus a decent outdoor pool. The restaurant/bar area is adequate when you need a quick meal and don't have time to get out. In terms of the area, it is obvious that lots of folks reviewing this hotel are not used to being in large, metropolitan areas. This area is no worse than any sizable city's downtown district. Yes, there are a few homeless folks and loiterers hanging around, but I've never had anyone approach me panhandling, etc. During the day, the streets are bustling with office workers, it's only after 7 PM that many local stores and cafes close up. That is probably my only complaint about the area, you do need to walk a few blocks to get to any place in the evening to eat. However, Bayfront Marketplace has numerous choices, plus in the direction of Brickell Ave. there are several upscale choices such as the Capital Grille and Azul in the Mandarin Oriental Hotel (great places to take customers!) If you are looking for a good jog/walk in the morning, head over the bridge to Brickell Key and do a couple laps around. Beautiful water views on a nice walkway that is very conducive for exercising.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Miami Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 200 SE Second Avenue, Miami, FL 33131
